content.question: A student wants to determine the resistance of two resistors by connecting them to a battery and using voltmeters <math alttext="V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and ammeters <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to take measurements of potential difference and current, respectively. Which of the following circuits would be best for finding the rate at which energy is dissipated for each of the two resistors?

choices.label: The figure presents a rectangular circuit with a vertical middle branch. Beginning on the left and moving clockwise, the left side has a battery. The top side to the left of the vertical branch has a voltmeter, and the top side to the right of the vertical branch has another voltmeter. The right side has a resistor with an ammeter underneath. The vertical middle branch has a resistor with an ammeter underneath.

The figure presents a rectangular circuit with middle vertical branch. Beginning on the left side and moving clockwise, the left side has a battery. The top side to the left of the vertical branch has a voltmeter. The right side has a resistor with a voltmeter underneath. The middle vertical branch has a resistor with an ammeter underneath.

The figure presents a rectangular circuit with middle vertical branch. Beginning on the left side and moving clockwise, the left side has a battery. The top side to the left of the vertical branch has an ammeter. The right side has a resistor with an ammeter underneath. The middle vertical branch has a resistor with a voltmeter underneath.

The figure presents a rectangular circuit with two vertical branches in the middle. Beginning on the left side of the rectangle and moving clockwise, the left side has a battery. The top side to the left of both middle vertical branches has an ammeter. The right side has a voltmeter. The middle vertical branch on the left has a resistor with a voltmeter underneath, and the middle vertical branch on the right has a resistor.

The figure presents a rectangular circuit with two vertical branches in the middle. Beginning on the left side of the rectangle and moving clockwise, the left side has a battery. The right side has a voltmeter. Both vertical branches in the middle each have a resistor with an ammeter underneath.

content.answer: The figure presents a rectangular circuit with two vertical branches in the middle. Beginning on the left side of the rectangle and moving clockwise, the left side has a battery. The right side has a voltmeter. Both vertical branches in the middle each have a resistor with an ammeter underneath.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
